# actionIdentifier

**Instance Property**

The identifier string of the action that the user selected.

## Declaration

```swift
var actionIdentifier: String { get }
```

## Discussion

This parameter may contain one the identifier of one of your [doc://com.apple.usernotifications/documentation/UserNotifications/UNNotificationAction] objects or it may contain a system-defined identifier. The system defined identifiers are [doc://com.apple.usernotifications/documentation/UserNotifications/UNNotificationDefaultActionIdentifier] and [doc://com.apple.usernotifications/documentation/UserNotifications/UNNotificationDismissActionIdentifier], which indicate that the user opened the app or dismissed the notification without any further actions.

For more information about defining custom actions, see [doc://com.apple.usernotifications/documentation/UserNotifications/declaring-your-actionable-notification-types].

## Getting the Response Information

- **notification**: The notification to which the user responded.
- **targetScene**: The scene where the system reflects the user’s response to a notification.
- **UNNotificationDefaultActionIdentifier**: An action that indicates the user opened the app from the notification interface.
- **UNNotificationDismissActionIdentifier**: The action that indicates the user explicitly dismissed the notification interface.
